As an AI language model, I can recommend a few things that can help you find the right Pilates class with a great instructor:

1. Do your research: Check out the websites of local Pilates studios and gyms, read reviews, and talk to friends who have experience with Pilates. Look for a class that offers what you're interested in, whether that's mat Pilates, reformer Pilates or other variations.

2. Attend different classes: Try out different Pilates classes at your local studios or gyms. Attend one or two classes with each instructor to get a feel for their teaching style and how well they communicate with their students.

3. Look for certification: Look for instructors who are certified through a reputable organization, such as the Pilates Method Alliance or Polestar Pilates. This ensures that they have undergone extensive training and follow a standardized curriculum.

4. Discuss your fitness goals with your instructor: Talk to your instructor about your fitness goals and concerns. A good instructor should be willing to work with you to develop a customized plan that meets your specific needs.

5. Trust your instincts: Listen to your gut instincts about whether a class or instructor is the right fit for you. If you feel uncomfortable or unsure, it may be worth trying a different class or instructor. 

Remember, finding the right Pilates class with a great instructor can take some time, but it's worth the effort to find the right fit for you.
